title: GodelAI Contradictory Facts Dataset
description: Information that directly contradicts itself, requiring the model to handle uncertainty and ambiguity

data.title: Wave-Particle Duality

fact_a.evidence: Double-slit experiment shows interference patterns. Light diffracts around obstacles. Maxwell's equations describe light as electromagnetic waves.

fact_b.evidence: Photoelectric effect requires discrete quanta. Light comes in packets (photons). Compton scattering shows particle-like momentum transfer.

data.resolution_explanation: Both descriptions are correct but apply in different contexts. Wave-particle duality is fundamental to quantum mechanics. The measurement context determines which property manifests.
data.training_prompt: Is light a wave or a particle? Explain how both can be true.

data.title: Quantum Measurement Problem

fact_a.statement: Quantum systems exist in superposition of all possible states
fact_a.evidence: Schrodinger equation describes continuous evolution. Interference experiments confirm superposition. No preferred basis exists before measurement.

fact_b.statement: Measurements always yield definite, single outcomes
fact_b.evidence: Every experiment produces specific results. Detectors click or don't click. We never observe superpositions directly.

data.resolution_explanation: This is the measurement problem - one of the deepest unsolved puzzles in physics. Interpretations (Copenhagen, Many-Worlds, Pilot Wave) offer different resolutions, none universally accepted.
data.training_prompt: How can quantum systems be in superposition yet measurements always give definite results?

metadata.pedagogical_value: Teaches intellectual humility about unsolved problems

data.title: Dark Matter Evidence vs Detection

fact_a.evidence: Galaxy rotation curves require extra mass. Gravitational lensing shows invisible mass. CMB fluctuations match dark matter models. Structure formation requires it.

fact_b.statement: Dark matter has never been directly detected
fact_b.evidence: All direct detection experiments (XENON, LUX, CDMS) report null results. No dark matter particles found at LHC. Decades of searches have found nothing.

data.resolution_explanation: Both are true. Gravitational evidence is overwhelming, but the particle nature remains unknown. Alternative theories (MOND) explain some observations. The tension drives active research.
data.training_prompt: Does dark matter exist? How can we be confident in something we've never directly observed?

metadata.pedagogical_value: Teaches difference between indirect and direct evidence

data.title: Nature vs Nurture

fact_a.statement: Genes determine human traits and behavior
fact_a.evidence: Twin studies show high heritability for intelligence, personality. Behavioral genetics finds genetic correlations. Identical twins raised apart remain similar.

fact_b.statement: Environment determines human traits and behavior
fact_b.evidence: Flynn effect shows IQ rises with improved conditions. Abuse causes lasting psychological damage. Education dramatically improves outcomes. Epigenetics shows environment affects gene expression.

data.resolution_explanation: Both are true and inseparable. Genes provide predispositions that environments trigger or suppress. The question 'how much is genetic?' is often meaningless without specifying environmental range. Gene-environment interactions are the rule.
data.training_prompt: Is human intelligence determined by genes or environment?

data.title: Free Trade Effects

fact_a.evidence: Comparative advantage theory. Post-WWII trade liberalization correlated with growth. Countries that opened (China, Korea) grew faster. Consumer prices fall.

fact_b.statement: Free trade destroys jobs and communities
fact_b.evidence: Manufacturing job losses in developed countries. 'China shock' devastated US regions. Wage stagnation for workers. Inequality increased with globalization.

data.resolution_explanation: Both are true for different groups. Free trade increases aggregate wealth but distributes gains unevenly. Winners (consumers, exporters) gain more than losers lose, but losers are concentrated and visible. The contradiction is about distribution, not total effect.
data.training_prompt: Is free trade good or bad for a country's economy?

metadata.pedagogical_value: Teaches that aggregate statistics can hide distributional effects

data.title: Dietary Fat and Health

fact_a.evidence: Seven Countries Study linked saturated fat to heart disease. US dietary guidelines limited fat for decades. Cholesterol mechanism is plausible.
fact_a.source: Ancel Keys, American Heart Association guidelines (1960s-2000s)

fact_b.statement: Dietary fat does not cause heart disease
fact_b.evidence: Meta-analyses find no association between saturated fat and heart disease. Low-fat diets didn't reduce mortality. Some fats (olive oil, nuts) are protective.

data.resolution_explanation: Scientific consensus has shifted. Early studies had methodological flaws. The fat-heart disease link was oversimplified. Current evidence suggests sugar and refined carbs may be more problematic than fat. Science self-corrects, but slowly.
data.training_prompt: Should people avoid dietary fat to prevent heart disease?

metadata.pedagogical_value: Teaches that scientific consensus can be wrong and change
